igala: E̩gba abakwane̩ ejodudu O̩jo̩ nyi efojale kpai ane̩-ile̩.
english: In the beginning God created the heaven and the earth.

igala: Ane̩-ile̩-i la de̩ juguu te̩ ofofo, oñ e̩chubi bʼeju o̩lulu le̩ ma; Afu O̩jo̩ la tʼeju omi ale bebebe.
english:
And the earth was without form, and void; and darkness
was
 upon the face of the deep. And the Spirit of God moved upon the face of the waters.

igala: Oñ O̩jo̩ kakini, Ugane̩ ki do̩mo̩; tak ugane̩ do̩mo̩.
english: And God said, Let there be light: and there was light.

igala: O̩jo̩ la fʼugane̩ le̩ li kʼi nyo̩; tak O̩jo̩ fʼugane̩ daru bʼe̩chubi te̩.
english:
And God saw the light, that
it was good: and God divided the light from the darkness.

igala: O̩jo̩ la do̩ ugane̩ le̩ ko̩ o̩ro̩ka, e̩chubi i la do̩ ko̩ odu. Oñ ane̩ do̩mo̩, odudu la do̩mo̩, o̩jo̩ ejodudu.
english: And God called the light Day, and the darkness he called Night. And the evening and the morning were the first day.

igala: Tak O̩jo̩ kakini, Agbagba ki te̩ alumeji omi le̩, kʼi fʼomiofo daru bʼomiofo te̩.
english: And God said, Let there be a firmament in the midst of the waters, and let it divide the waters from the waters.

igala: Oñ O̩jo̩ fʼagbagba che te̩, i la fʼomiofo e-ki dʼo̩gane̩ agbagba le̩ daru bʼomiofo e-ki dʼate̩ agbagba le̩ te̩. Abe̩le̩ i la de̩.
english:
And God made the firmament, and divided the waters which
were
 under the firmament from the waters which
were above the firmament: and it was so.

igala: Tak O̩jo̩ do̩ agbagba le̩ ko̩ efojale. Oñ ane̩ do̩mo̩, odudu la do̩mo̩, o̩jo̩ ekeji.
english: And God called the firmament Heaven. And the evening and the morning were the second day.

igala: Tak O̩jo̩ kakini, Omiofo o̩gane̩ efojale ki najeju jʼugbo okate ke, ane̩ e̩gbe̩ ki kwotejugede. Abe̩le̩ i la de̩.
english:
And God said, Let the waters under the heaven be gathered together unto one place, and let the dry
land appear: and it was so.

igala: Oñ O̩jo̩ do̩ ane̩ e̩gbe̩ le̩ ko̩ ane̩-ile̩, ujeju omi i la do̩ ko̩ ohimini abadi. O̩jo̩ la li kʼi nyo̩.
english:
And God called the dry
land Earth; and the gathering together of the waters called he Seas: and God saw that
it was good.

igala: Tak O̩jo̩ kakini, Ane̩-ile̩-i ki lu ije̩, kpai eñmi kʼi aro ulu-wñ, kpai oli ki aro e̩go̩ uche̩ o̩la-wñ, e-kʼe̩yo̩-wñ dʼef uwñ, ane̩-ile̩. Abe̩le̩ i la de̩.
english:
And God said, Let the earth bring forth grass, the herb yielding seed,
and the fruit tree yielding fruit after his kind, whose seed
is in itself, upon the earth: and it was so.

igala: Tak ane̩-ile̩ lu ije̩, owñ chʼeñmi ki aro ulu e̩go̩ uche̩ o̩la-wñ, kpai oli ki aro kʼe̩yo̩ dʼef e̩ro-wñ e̩go̩ uche̩ o̩la-wñ. O̩jo̩ la li kʼi nyo̩.
english:
And the earth brought forth grass,
and herb yielding seed after his kind, and the tree yielding fruit, whose seed
was in itself, after his kind: and God saw that
it was good.

igala: Oñ ane̩ do̩mo̩, odudu la do̩mo̩, o̩jo̩ e̩ke̩ta.
english: And the evening and the morning were the third day.

igala: Abe̩le̩ O̩jo̩ fʼe̩mu elile meji le̩ che, e̩mu e-ki tule ki nʼo̩da o̩ro̩ka, e̩mu e-ki nya ki nʼo̩da odu; kpai ilawo ge̩.
english: And God said, Let there be lights in the firmament of the heaven to divide the day from the night; and let them be for signs, and for seasons, and for days, and years:

igala: Oñ ane̩ do̩mo̩, odudu la do̩mo̩, o̩jo̩ e̩ke̩le̩.
english: And let them be for lights in the firmament of the heaven to give light upon the earth: and it was so.

igala: Tak O̩jo̩ kakini, Ef omi ki ko̩ ñw amonugo e̩wñ iñmi ke, ame̩we̩ ki nawu ate̩ ane̩-ile̩ ef agbagba ki che̩chi te̩ efojale.
english:
And God made two great lights; the greater light to rule the day, and the lesser light to rule the night:
he made the stars also.

igala: Abe̩le̩ O̩jo̩ nyi ame̩la lile ki jʼef omi, kpai onugo e̩wñ iñmi du ki achiche̩, e-ki che̩ko̩ ef omi, uche̩ uche̩-ma, kpai e̩we̩ du ki nʼika uche̩ uche̩-wñ: O̩jo̩ la li kʼi nyo̩.
english: And God set them in the firmament of the heaven to give light upon the earth,

igala: Tak O̩jo̩ de̩nyo̩ ñw uma kakini, Ame̩ ki rabi ku me̩ wewe nyo̩gba ku me̩ che̩ko̩ ef omi ohimini abadi, ame̩we̩ ki nawewe nyo̩gba ane̩-ile̩.
english:
And to rule over the day and over the night, and to divide the light from the darkness: and God saw that
it was good.

igala: Oñ ane̩ do̩mo̩, odudu la do̩mo̩, o̩jo̩ e̩ke̩lu.
english: And the evening and the morning were the fourth day.

igala: Tak O̩jo̩ kakini, Ile̩ ki nakʼamonugo e̩wñ iñmi dufu uche̩ uche̩-ma, ame̩la abe̩re̩me̩le̩ kpai ame̩wñ ki afa kpai ame̩wñ iñmi ane̩-ile̩ uche̩ uche̩-ma. Abe̩le̩ i la de̩.
english:
And God said, Let the waters bring forth abundantly the moving creature that hath life, and fowl
that may fly above the earth in the open firmament of heaven.

igala: Tak O̩jo̩ che ame̩wñ iñmi ane̩-ile̩-i uche̩ uche̩-ma, kpai ame̩la abe̩re̩me̩le̩ uche̩ uche̩-ma, kpai ame̩wñ du ki afa ane̩pe̩te̩ uche̩ uche̩-ma: O̩jo̩ la li kʼi nyo̩.
english:
And God created great whales, and every living creature that moveth, which the waters brought forth abundantly, after their kind, and every winged fowl after his kind: and God saw that
it was good.

igala: Tak O̩jo̩ kakini, Awa ki che one̩ rʼojibo-wa, ku ma bi awa onugo: ama ki la nʼo̩da ame̩ja ki jʼef ohimini abadi, kpai ame̩we̩ ojale, kpai ame̩la abe̩re̩me̩le̩, kpai ane̩-ile̩ du, kpai e̩wñ du ki afa, e-ki afa ane̩-ile̩-i.
english: And God blessed them, saying, Be fruitful, and multiply, and fill the waters in the seas, and let fowl multiply in the earth.

igala: Abe̩le̩ O̩jo̩ fʼone̩ nyi ojibo-wñ onugo, e̩go̩ ojibo O̩jo̩ oñ i nyʼi; e̩ne̩ke̩le̩ kpai onobule̩ oñ i nyi ma.
english: And the evening and the morning were the fifth day.

igala: Tak O̩jo̩ de̩nyo̩ ñw uma, O̩jo̩ la ka ñw uma kakini, Ame̩ ki bi o̩ma, ku me̩ ki wewe nyo̩gba ku me̩ che̩ko̩ ane̩-ile̩-i ku me̩ fʼu dolo te̩; ame̩ ki la nʼo̩da ame̩ja ef ohimini kpai ame̩we̩ ojale kpai ame̩wñ iñmi du ki achiche̩ ane̩-ile̩-i.
english: And God said, Let the earth bring forth the living creature after his kind, cattle, and creeping thing, and beast of the earth after his kind: and it was so.

igala: Tak O̩jo̩ kakini, Go, omi mʼeñmi kwe̩ kwe̩ kwe̩ du ki aro ulu-wñ ko ñw ume̩, e-du ki bʼane̩-ile̩ ma, kpai oli du kʼe̩ro-wñ nʼe̩yo̩ efu; e-le̩ achʼuje̩wñ ñw ame̩.
english:
And God made the beast of the earth after his kind, and cattle after their kind, and every thing that creepeth upon the earth after his kind: and God saw that
it was good.

igala: Kpai ame̩wñ iñmi ane̩-ile̩ okoke du, kpai ame̩we̩ ojale okoke du, kpai ame̩wñ du ki afa ane̩-ile̩-i; e-du kʼonugo e-iñmi dʼef uwñ, e̩wñ eñmi emimi kwe̩ kwe̩ kwe̩ du chʼutodu uje̩wñ. Abe̩le̩ i la de̩.
english: And God said, Let us make man in our image, after our likeness: and let them have dominion over the fish of the sea, and over the fowl of the air, and over the cattle, and over all the earth, and over every creeping thing that creepeth upon the earth.

igala: Abe̩le̩ efojale kpai ane̩-ile̩ fʼoji ne̩ kpa, kpai uwewe ame̩wñ-ma du.
english: And God blessed them, and God said unto them, Be fruitful, and multiply, and replenish the earth, and subdue it: and have dominion over the fish of the sea, and over the fowl of the air, and over every living thing that moveth upon the earth.

igala: Oñ o̩jo̩ ekebie̩-wñ uko̩lo̩ kʼO̩jo̩ che le̩ takpa, tak o̩jo̩ ekebie le̩ i ñmi uko̩lo̩-wñ du kʼi che.
english:
And God said, Behold, I have given you every herb bearing seed, which
is upon the face of all the earth, and every tree, in the which
is the fruit of a tree yielding seed; to you it shall be for meat.

igala:
Tak O̩jo̩ de̩nyo̩ ñw o̩jo̩ ekebie le̩ i la chʼo kʼi fo̩, todabu ki chʼo̩jo̩ kʼi ñmi uko̩lo̩-wñ du e-kʼO̩jo̩ nyi kpai e-kʼi che.
Ade̩m kpai If ef uche̩ Ide̩n
english:
And to every beast of the earth, and to every fowl of the air, and to every thing that creepeth upon the earth, wherein
there is life,
I have given every green herb for meat: and it was so.

igala: Inabali efojale kpai ane̩-ile̩-i e̩gba ku ma nyi ma, o̩jo̩ ki Jihofa O̩jo̩ che ane̩-ile̩ kpai efojale le̩ de̩.
english:
And God saw every thing that he had made, and, behold,
it was
 very good. And the evening and the morning were the sixth day.

igala: Odu ohimini e̩ke̩ta la ko̩ Hide̩ke̩l: e-le̩ chʼe-kʼi a cha lʼo̩wo̩ olodudu Asiria le̩. Oñ ohimini e̩ke̩le̩ che Yufretis.
english: Thus the heavens and the earth were finished, and all the host of them.

igala: Oñ Jihofa O̩jo̩ mʼone̩ du, oñ i mʼu du tef uche̩ Ide̩n kʼi lʼo, kʼi la nade.
english: And on the seventh day God ended his work which he had made; and he rested on the seventh day from all his work which he had made.

igala: Taku Jihofa O̩jo̩ kakini, I nyo̩ kʼone̩ kate kʼi do̩mo̩ abe̩le̩ n; omi ache e̩ne̩ ki abʼo̩ che kʼi chʼoje̩go̩-wñ.
english: And God blessed the seventh day, and sanctified it: because that in it he had rested from all his work which God created and made.

igala: Jihofa O̩jo̩ la nʼike̩te̩ bo̩ ame̩wñ iñmi oko okoke du, kpai ame̩we̩ ojale okoke du; tak i mʼu ko wʼugbo one̩ kʼi go alu kʼi adʼodu ñw uma: oñ e̩wñ du kʼone̩ dʼodu onugo e̩wñ iñmi le̩ okoke du ko̩, mak e-le̩ chʼodu-wñ.
english:
These
are the generations of the heavens and of the earth when they were created, in the day that the LORD God made the earth and the heavens,

igala: Oñ one̩ mʼodu du ñw ame̩la abe̩re̩me̩le̩ du, kpai ame̩we̩ ojale, kpai ame̩wñ iñmi oko okoke du; ma muda li e̩ne̩ kʼi chʼoje̩go̩ one̩ kʼi abʼo̩ che n.
english:
And every plant of the field before it was in the earth, and every herb of the field before it grew: for the LORD God had not caused it to rain upon the earth, and
there was not a man to till the ground.

igala:
Tak one̩ kakini,
Ihii, fai tak e-kide̩ chʼachiku ki kwef achiku e-mi kpai o̩re̩la ki kwef o̩re̩la-mi;
ma adʼodu-wñ ko̩ Onobule̩,
todabu ku ma mʼu du kwef One̩.
english: But there went up a mist from the earth, and watered the whole face of the ground.

igala: Todule̩ e̩ne̩ke̩le̩ atʼata-wñ kpai iye-wñ no̩ kʼi la amanyʼo̩ya-wñ, oñ ama amud o̩re̩la okate.
english:
And the LORD God formed man
of the dust of the ground, and breathed into his nostrils the breath of life; and man became a living soul.

igala:
Ama meji la tago ofo, owñ chʼone̩ kpai o̩ya-wñ, ma la chanyo̩ n.
One̩ muñwa nane̩
english: And the LORD God planted a garden eastward in Eden; and there he put the man whom he had formed.

igala: Ejo le̩ la gbeju tʼame̩wñ iñmi oko du ki Jihofa O̩jo̩ che le. Oñ i ka ñw onobule̩ le̩ kakini, Ochochi, O̩jo̩ ka kʼame̩ ki jʼe̩ro oli du ef uche̩-i n?
english: And out of the ground made the LORD God to grow every tree that is pleasant to the sight, and good for food; the tree of life also in the midst of the garden, and the tree of knowledge of good and evil.

igala: Ama ejo le̩ ka ñw onobule̩ kakini, I chʼeku me̩ aku n.
english: And a river went out of Eden to water the garden; and from thence it was parted, and became into four heads.

igala: Todu O̩jo̩ chema ka kʼo̩jo̩ ku me̩ je̩ e-le̩ e̩gbale̩ tak eju-me̩ ane̩, taku me̩ adab O̩jo̩, me̩ ama e̩nyo̩ kpai e̩bie̩ne̩.
english:
The name of the first
is Pison: that
is it which compasseth the whole land of Havilah, where
there is gold;

igala: Tak onobule̩ le̩ li ka kʼoli le̩ chenyo̩ todu uje̩wñ, kʼi laño̩ chʼuto̩ eju, kʼoli le̩ laño̩ chʼe̩wñ ki nyo̩ one̩ eju kʼi aje̩ ñw u nʼibe, i mʼe̩ro-wñ ka i la mudu je̩; i ño̩ mudu ñw o̩ko̩-wñ kpai owñ, i laño̩ je̩ ge̩.
english:
And the gold of that land
is good: there
is bdellium and the onyx stone.

igala: Tak eju-ma meji mune̩, oñ ma ma ka ku ma tago ofo; taku ma fʼeñmi o̩gbaikolo ga mʼomune̩ oñ ma mʼu ko che e̩wñ ulago ñw o̩la-ma.
english:
And the name of the second river
is Gihon: the same
is it that compasseth the whole land of Ethiopia.

igala: Taku ma gbo̩ abu ku Jihofa O̩jo̩ alule̩ ef uche̩ le̩ adiko e̩gba kʼafu afe̩rʼo̩la, tak one̩ kpai o̩ya-wñ mʼo̩la-ma ko maja bʼeju Jihofa O̩jo̩ te̩ ef ujʼoli uche̩ le̩.
english:
And the name of the third river
is Hiddekel: that
is
 it which goeth toward the east of Assyria. And the fourth river
is Euphrates.

igala: Taku Jihofa O̩jo̩ nomudala do̩ one̩, i la ka ñw u kakini, Ugbo e̩ de̩?
english: And the LORD God took the man, and put him into the garden of Eden to dress it and to keep it.

igala: Oñ i kakini, U gbʼiche̩-we̩ ef uche̩, oñ u railo, todabu kʼu tago ofo; tak u dʼo̩lami maja-i.
english: And the LORD God commanded the man, saying, Of every tree of the garden thou mayest freely eat:

igala: Tak i kakini, E̩ne̩ ka ñw e̩ ka kʼe̩ tago ofo? Uwe̩ je̩ e̩ro oli e-kʼomi tuko̩ ñw e̩ ka kʼe̩ we eje̩ le̩?
english: But of the tree of the knowledge of good and evil, thou shalt not eat of it: for in the day that thou eatest thereof thou shalt surely die.

igala: Tak one̩ kakini, Onobule̩ kʼe̩ duwa kʼi dʼugbo mi, owñ mʼe̩ro oli le̩ du ñw mi, oñ u mʼu du je̩.
english:
And the LORD God said,
It is not good that the man should be alone; I will make him an help meet for him.

igala: Taku Jihofa O̩jo̩ ka ñw onobule̩ le̩ kakini, E̩wñ chʼe-kʼuwe̩ che-i? Tak onobule̩ le̩ kakini, Ejo le̩ gba mi ibe, tak u je̩.
english:
And out of the ground the LORD God formed every beast of the field, and every fowl of the air; and brought
them unto Adam to see what he would call them: and whatsoever Adam called every living creature, that
was the name thereof.

igala:
Taku Jihofa O̩jo̩ ka ñw ejo kakini,
Todabu kʼuwe̩ che-i,
uwe̩ oñ ama amu tʼame̩wño̩re̩,
kpai ame̩la oko du le;
efu-we̩ oñ e̩ ne̩ alule̩,
ebutu e̩ ñʼaje̩
o̩jo̩ du kʼudeju-we̩ kade.
english: And Adam gave names to all cattle, and to the fowl of the air, and to every beast of the field; but for Adam there was not found an help meet for him.

igala:
Nanyi o̩la tʼagbagba uwe̩ kpai onobule̩,
kpai agbagba ugbe̩-we̩ kpai ugbe̩-wñ;
i afʼuwe̩ oji gwenunu,
oñ uwe̩ afʼowñ agbe̩re̩ gwenunu.
english: And the LORD God caused a deep sleep to fall upon Adam and he slept: and he took one of his ribs, and closed up the flesh instead thereof;

igala:
Tak i ka ñw onobule̩ kakini,
Naje̩ ñw e̩do̩ e̩kpabie̩-we̩ ki nana nyo̩gba ololo kpai efu-we̩ kʼe̩ nyo̩;
o̩ma ebi-we̩ achʼe̩do̩dudu ñw e̩,
uwe̩ añeju o̩ko̩-we̩ kpo̩o̩,
owñ la anʼo̩da uwe̩.
english: And the rib, which the LORD God had taken from man, made he a woman, and brought her unto the man.

igala: One̩ la dʼodu o̩ya-wñ ko̩ If todabu kʼowñ chʼugugu iye ñw e̩wñ du ki deju.
english: Therefore shall a man leave his father and his mother, and shall cleave unto his wife: and they shall be one flesh.

igala: Taku Jihofa O̩jo̩ fʼafe̩ año̩ che tod one̩ kpai o̩ya-wñ, oñ i mʼu du tʼo̩la-ma.
english: And they were both naked, the man and his wife, and were not ashamed.

igala: E̩gba kʼe̩ luche̩ ane̩-i, akwe̩gba-i i ñʼadʼukpahiu-wñ ñw e̩ ge̩ n; e̩nara kpai e̩nujulu oñ uwe̩ ache ane̩-ile̩-i.
english: Now the serpent was more subtil than any beast of the field which the LORD God had made. And he said unto the woman, Yea, hath God said, Ye shall not eat of every tree of the garden?

igala: Taki Ken ka ñwu Jihofa kakini, Udu kʼe̩ bu mi-i i nana tʼumi le.
english: And the woman said unto the serpent, We may eat of the fruit of the trees of the garden:

igala: Go, e̩ fʼumi ne bʼeju ane̩ te̩ eñini-i me̩; u la ñʼamaja bʼeju-we̩ te̩ ge̩; tak u nachʼe̩nara kpai e̩nujulu ane̩-ile̩, i dʼabe̩le̩ mak e̩ne̩ du kʼi li mi adʼumi kpa.
english:
But of the fruit of the tree which
is in the midst of the garden, God hath said, Ye shall not eat of it, neither shall ye touch it, lest ye die.

igala: Taku Jihofa ka ñw u kakini, I chʼabe̩le̩ n! E̩ne̩ du kʼi du Ken kpa, ma akpʼo̩chi-wñ onu mebie. Taki Jihofa mʼujiwe du gamu Ken o̩la, tode̩gba kʼe̩ne̩ kʼi liʼu adʼu kpa.
english: And the serpent said unto the woman, Ye shall not surely die:

igala: Taki Ken kwo bʼeju Jihofa te̩, oñ i kwo gugu ane̩ No̩d, o̩wo̩ olodudu Ide̩n.
english: For God doth know that in the day ye eat thereof, then your eyes shall be opened, and ye shall be as gods, knowing good and evil.

igala: Taki Ken fʼo̩ya-wñ ma, oñ i fʼefu nyo̩ i la fʼIno̩k bi; tak i le teke fʼodoʼka do, i la mʼodu ewo le̩ du rodu o̩ma-wñ, Ino̩k.
english:
And when the woman saw that the tree
was good for food, and that it
was pleasant to the eyes, and a tree to be desired to make
one wise, she took of the fruit thereof, and did eat, and gave also unto her husband with her; and he did eat.

igala: Ma la bi Irad ñw Ino̩k; Irad la bi Me̩hujae̩l, Me̩hujae̩l la bi Me̩tushae̩l, Me̩tushae̩l la bi Lame̩k.
english:
And the eyes of them both were opened, and they knew that they
were naked; and they sewed fig leaves together, and made themselves aprons.

igala: Taki Lame̩k fʼo̩ya meji ne̩ ñw o̩la-wñ; odu oka ko̩ Ada, oñ odu ekeji-wñ ko̩ Zila.
english: And they heard the voice of the LORD God walking in the garden in the cool of the day: and Adam and his wife hid themselves from the presence of the LORD God amongst the trees of the garden.

igala: Ada la bi Jabal; owñ chʼata abo ku ma gugu ef unyabo ku ma ne̩ ame̩wñ-ukpa.
english:
And the LORD God called unto Adam, and said unto him, Where
art
 thou?

igala: Odu o̩maye-wñ e̩ne̩ke̩le̩ ko̩ Jubal; owñ la chʼata abo du ku ma nʼumolo kpai o̩kpachine̩.
english:
And he said, I heard thy voice in the garden, and I was afraid, because I
was naked; and I hid myself.

igala: Taki Zila, onobule̩ le̩, bi Tubal-ken, owñ chʼe̩ne̩ kʼi anʼebijeikpa kpai ebije gwu e̩wñ eku ojoji du. O̩maye Tubal-ken onobule̩ che Naama.
english:
And he said, Who told thee that thou
wast naked? Hast thou eaten of the tree, whereof I commanded thee that thou shouldest not eat?

And the man said, The woman whom thou gavest
to be with me, she gave me of the tree, and I did eat.

igala:
Iche̩wñ ku ma akpʼo̩chi Ken onu mebie,
mak e-Lame̩k achʼe̩te̩gwa nyoke mebie.
english:
And the LORD God said unto the woman, What
is this
that
 thou hast done? And the woman said, The serpent beguiled me, and I did eat.

igala: Ade̩m ño̩ fʼo̩ya-wñ ma ge̩, oñ i fʼo̩me̩ne̩ke̩le̩ bi i la dʼodu-wñ ko̩ Se̩t, todu O̩jo̩ mʼugbe̩ omune̩ dute̩ ñwu mi koji Ebe̩l me̩, todu Ken fʼowñ kpa.
english:
And the LORD God said unto the serpent, Because thou hast done this, thou
art cursed above all cattle, and above every beast of the field; upon thy belly shalt thou go, and dust shalt thou eat all the days of thy life:

igala:
Se̩t ge̩, ma ño̩ fʼo̩me̩ne̩ke̩le̩ bi ñw u, tak i dʼodu-wñ ko̩ Ino̩sh. E̩gbale̩ tak amone̩ chane̩ e̩do̩ odu Jihofa.
Akwo Ade̩m wa Noa
english: And I will put enmity between thee and the woman, and between thy seed and her seed; it shall bruise thy head, and thou shalt bruise his heel.

igala: O̩takada o̩lo̩pu Ade̩m o̩gba o̩gba de̩. Iko o̩jo̩ kʼO̩jo̩ nyi one̩ i chʼo kʼi biu O̩jo̩.
english:
Unto the woman he said, I will greatly multiply thy sorrow and thy conception; in sorrow thou shalt bring forth children; and thy desire
shall be to thy husband, and he shall rule over thee.

igala: O̩ko̩ kpai o̩ya oñ i nyi ma, i laño̩ de̩nyo̩ ñwu ma oñ i dʼodu-ma ko̩ Ade̩m o̩jo̩ kʼi nyi ma.
Ade̩m la dʼo̩do̩ o̩gbo̩ me̩fa nyoke me̩gwa, tak i bi o̩me̩ne̩ke̩le̩ ki chebiu owñ onugo, dab ojibo-wñ, i la dʼodu-wñ ko̩ Se̩t.
english: Thorns also and thistles shall it bring forth to thee; and thou shalt eat the herb of the field;

igala: Oñ o̩jo̩ Ade̩m abu kʼi fu Se̩t bi ño̩ jo̩ o̩do̩ icham; i ño̩ bi amo̩ma e̩ne̩ke̩le̩ kpai onobule̩.
english:
In the sweat of thy face shalt thou eat bread, till thou return unto the ground; for out of it wast thou taken: for dust thou
art, and unto dust shalt thou return.

igala: O̩jo̩ kʼAde̩m deju chaka du la chʼo̩do̩ icham nyʼo̩gbo̩ me̩fa nyoke me̩gwa; tak i leku.
english: And Adam called his wife’s name Eve; because she was the mother of all living.

igala: Se̩t la dʼo̩do̩ ogume̩lu nyoke me̩lu, tak i bi Ino̩sh.
english: Unto Adam also and to his wife did the LORD God make coats of skins, and clothed them.

igala: Abu kʼi fʼIno̩sh bi Se̩t ño̩ deju o̩do̩ icham nyoke mebie, i laño̩ bi amo̩ma e̩ne̩ke̩le̩ kpai onobule̩.
english: And the LORD God said, Behold, the man is become as one of us, to know good and evil: and now, lest he put forth his hand, and take also of the tree of life, and eat, and live for ever:

igala: Abe̩le̩ o̩jo̩ Se̩t chaka du la chʼo̩do̩ icham nyʼogume̩lu nyoke me̩gweji; tak i leku.
english: Therefore the LORD God sent him forth from the garden of Eden, to till the ground from whence he was taken.

igala: Oñ Ino̩sh deju o̩do̩ o̩gbo̩ me̩le̩ nyoke me̩gwa, tak i bi Kenan.
english: So he drove out the man; and he placed at the east of the garden of Eden Cherubim, and a flaming sword which turned every way, to keep the way of the tree of life.

igala: Oñ Ino̩k deju o̩do̩ o̩gbo̩ me̩ta nyoke me̩lu, tak i bi Matusala.
english: And Adam knew Eve his wife; and she conceived, and bare Cain, and said, I have gotten a man from the LORD.

igala: Abu kʼi fu Matusala bi Ino̩k tale kpai O̩jo̩ o̩do̩ oli me̩fa, i ño̩ bi amo̩ma e̩ne̩ke̩le̩ kpai onobule̩.
english: And she again bare his brother Abel. And Abel was a keeper of sheep, but Cain was a tiller of the ground.

igala: Abe̩le̩ o̩jo̩ Ino̩k chaka du la che o̩do̩ oli mebie nyoke me̩gwe̩lu.
english: And in process of time it came to pass, that Cain brought of the fruit of the ground an offering unto the LORD.

igala: Ino̩k la tale kpai O̩jo̩; tak i ma ño̩ do̩mo̩ ge̩ n, todu O̩jo̩ mʼowñ du.
english: And Abel, he also brought of the firstlings of his flock and of the fat thereof. And the LORD had respect unto Abel and to his offering:

igala: Oñ Matusala deju o̩do̩ o̩gbo̩ me̩la nyoke mebie, tak i bi Lame̩k.
english: But unto Cain and to his offering he had not respect. And Cain was very wroth, and his countenance fell.

igala: Abu kʼi fu Lame̩k bi Matusala ño̩ deju o̩do̩ ulo̩gwa nyʼo̩gbo̩ me̩la nyoke meji, i laño̩ bi amo̩ma e̩ne̩ke̩le̩ kpai onobule̩.
english: And the LORD said unto Cain, Why art thou wroth? and why is thy countenance fallen?

igala: Abe̩le̩ o̩jo̩ Matusala chaka du la chʼo̩do̩ icham nyʼo̩gbo̩ me̩jo̩ nyoke me̩la; tak i leku.
english:
If thou doest well, shalt thou not be accepted? and if thou doest not well, sin lieth at the door. And unto thee
shall be his desire, and thou shalt rule over him.

igala: Abu kʼi fu Noa bi Lame̩k ño̩ deju o̩do̩ oke me̩lu chi ulo̩gwa, i laño̩ bi amo̩ma e̩ne̩ke̩le̩ kpai onobule̩.
english: And Cain talked with Abel his brother: and it came to pass, when they were in the field, that Cain rose up against Abel his brother, and slew him.

igala: Abe̩le̩ o̩jo̩ Lame̩k chaka du la chʼo̩do̩ ulo̩gwa nyʼo̩gbo̩ me̩jo̩ nyoke me̩gwebie; tak i leku.
english:
And the LORD said unto Cain, Where
is Abel thy brother? And he said, I know not:
Am I my brother’s keeper?

igala:
Oñ o̩do̩ Noa chʼoli me̩gwa: Noa la fu She̩m, kpai Ham, kpai Jefe̩t bi.
Inabali uwobi omi le̩
english: And he said, What hast thou done? the voice of thy brother’s blood crieth unto me from the ground.

igala: Taku Jihofa kakini, Afu-mi achakanya nyʼone̩ gbogbo alo ef ila-ma ge̩ n, todabu kʼowñ chʼo̩re̩la, o̩jo̩-wñ achʼo̩do̩ o̩gbo̩ me̩fa ta.
english:
And now
art thou cursed from the earth, which hath opened her mouth to receive thy brother’s blood from thy hand;

igala: Amakachi jʼane̩-ile̩ adiko le̩, kpai anubi-wñ ge̩, e̩gba kʼamo̩ma O̩jo̩ wʼejefu ugbo amo̩ma onobule̩ amone̩, ku ma bi amo̩ma ñwu ma. Abo kide̩ chʼamagbiti ku ma do̩mo̩ igbelegbele, ama chʼame̩nuwohi le̩.
english: When thou tillest the ground, it shall not henceforth yield unto thee her strength; a fugitive and a vagabond shalt thou be in the earth.

igala: Oñ Jihofa li kʼe̩bie̩ne̩ one̩ chʼololo ane̩-ile̩, kʼibe du ki dʼe̩do̩-wñ kʼi añwa chʼe̩bie̩ne̩ gbogbo dʼo̩jo̩.
english:
And Cain said unto the LORD, My punishment
is greater than I can bear.

igala: Tak e̩do̩ Jihofa murida ugbo one̩ kʼi che ane̩-ile̩, i la kpʼowñ e̩do̩ bie̩.
english:
Behold, thou hast driven me out this day from the face of the earth; and from thy face shall I be hid; and I shall be a fugitive and a vagabond in the earth; and it shall come to pass,
that every one that findeth me shall slay me.

igala: Taki Jihofa kakini, Nakpʼone̩ kʼu nyi le̩ lu bʼeju ane̩ te̩, tʼone̩, tʼe̩la abe̩re̩me̩le̩, tʼame̩wñ ki afa, tʼame̩we̩ ojale, todu e̩do̩-mi murida eche ma kʼu che ma le̩.
english: And the LORD said unto him, Therefore whosoever slayeth Cain, vengeance shall be taken on him sevenfold. And the LORD set a mark upon Cain, lest any finding him should kill him.

igala: Jihofa muda li Noa eju.
english: And Cain went out from the presence of the LORD, and dwelt in the land of Nod, on the east of Eden.

igala: Abo-i chʼo̩lo̩pu o̩gba o̩gba Noa. Noa chʼe̩ne̩ke̩le̩ o̩kpakpa, i mufu ef abo o̩gba-wñ; Noa tale kpai O̩jo̩.
english: And Cain knew his wife; and she conceived, and bare Enoch: and he builded a city, and called the name of the city, after the name of his son, Enoch.

igala: Noa fʼamo̩ma e̩ne̩ke̩le̩ me̩ta bi, She̩m, kpai Ham, kpai Jefe̩t.
english: And unto Enoch was born Irad: and Irad begat Mehujael: and Mehujael begat Methusael: and Methusael begat Lamech.

igala: Ane̩-ile̩-i la mubie̩ te̩ eju O̩jo̩, oñ o̩lachi che̩ko̩ ane̩-ile̩.
english:
And Lamech took unto him two wives: the name of the one
was
 Adah, and the name of the other Zillah.

igala: Tak O̩jo̩ fʼane̩-ile̩-i go, go, i la mubie̩ te̩: todu o̩re̩la du fʼo̩na-wñ bie̩ ane̩-ile̩.
english:
And Adah bare Jabal: he was the father of such as dwell in tents, and
of such as have cattle.

igala: Tak O̩jo̩ ka ñwu Noa kakini, Eda o̩re̩la du lewa o̩gba-mi me̩; todu ane̩-ile̩ che̩ko̩ ñw o̩lachi lugbo ma; go, omi akpʼama bie̩ manyu ane̩-ile̩.
english:
And his brother’s name
was Jubal: he was the father of all such as handle the harp and organ.

igala: Uwe̩ ki nʼoli go̩fe̩r chʼo̩ko̩; e̩ fʼefu o̩ko̩ le̩ ko̩da unyi unyi, kʼe̩ dʼo̩bia kwo̩ ejefu-wñ kpai e̩j o̩do̩da-wñ.
english:
And Zillah, she also bare Tubal-cain, an instructer of every artificer in brass and iron: and the sister of Tubal-cain
was Naamah.

igala: Alu kʼuwe̩ ache de̩: ujiji o̩ko̩ le̩ ki chʼohiba oli me̩fa, unula-wñ ki chʼohiba ooje, o̩gba-wñ ki chʼohiba ogue̩gwa.
english: And Lamech said unto his wives, Adah and Zillah, Hear my voice; ye wives of Lamech, hearken unto my speech: for I have slain a man to my wounding, and a young man to my hurt.

igala: E̩ ki che ope̩ o̩ko̩ le̩, ki bo̩ ohibaʼka ate̩-wñ; e̩ fʼalugbo̩na o̩ko̩ che akolo-wñ o̩wo̩ʼka; uwe̩ ki che kʼi ne̩ unyi o̩gane̩, kʼi nʼekeji ate̩-wñ, e̩ke̩ta ki la de̩ otitala-wñ ate̩.
english: If Cain shall be avenged sevenfold, truly Lamech seventy and sevenfold.

igala: Tak omi, e̩ go, nadʼuwobi omi wa bʼane̩-ile̩ ma kʼu kpa o̩re̩la du kʼafu iñmi dʼefu-wñ bie̩ bʼo̩gane̩ efojale te̩; e̩wñ du ki jʼane̩-ile̩ aku.
english:
And Adam knew his wife again; and she bare a son, and called his name Seth: For God,
said she, hath appointed me another seed instead of Abel, whom Cain slew.

igala: Omi muda akpʼalo-mi kpai uwe̩; uwe̩ la awʼef o̩ko̩ le̩, uwe̩, kpai amo̩ma-we̩ e̩ne̩ke̩le̩, kpai o̩ya-we̩, kpai amo̩ya amo̩ma-we̩ manyu uwe̩.
english: And to Seth, to him also there was born a son; and he called his name Enos: then began men to call upon the name of the LORD.

igala: Oñ i lewatu ab o̩jo̩ mebie jo̩ uwobi omi la bʼane̩-ile̩ ma.
english:
This
is the book of the generations of Adam. In the day that God created man, in the likeness of God made he him;

igala: Ef o̩do̩ udeju Noa e-ulo̩gwa le̩, ochu ekeji, o̩jo̩ e̩ke̩gwebie ochu le̩, o̩jo̩ le̩ gbage̩de̩ e̩bi omi o̩lulu mukpo̩fo̩, ope ojale la muchite̩.
english: Male and female created he them; and blessed them, and called their name Adam, in the day when they were created.

igala: Oñ omi ojale gulo̩ bʼane̩-ile̩ ma o̩jo̩ o̩gbo̩ meji kpai odu o̩gbo̩ meji.
english:
And Adam lived an hundred and thirty years, and begat
a son
 in his own likeness, after his image; and called his name Seth:

igala: Oñ ma le tef o̩ko̩ ugbo Noa, owñ chʼejʼeji o̩re̩la du e-kʼafu iñmi dʼefu-ma.
english: And the days of Adam after he had begotten Seth were eight hundred years: and he begat sons and daughters:

igala: Oñ abo ku ma tʼo̩, chʼo̩ko̩ kpai ole kwef o̩re̩la du alu kʼO̩jo̩ ñwa ñw u; taku Jihofa fʼo̩na re nyʼu.
english: And all the days that Adam lived were nine hundred and thirty years: and he died.

igala: Uwobi omi le̩ bʼane̩-ile̩ ma o̩jo̩ o̩gbo̩ meji; omi-wñ la nana nyo̩gba, oñ i dʼo̩ko̩ kwane̩, oñ i kwane̩ tʼate̩ ñw ane̩-ile̩.
english: And Seth lived an hundred and five years, and begat Enos:

igala: Tak omi le̩ fʼukpahiu che i la nana nyo̩gba ololo bʼane̩-ile̩ ma; oñ o̩ko̩ le̩ nʼeju omi.
english: And Seth lived after he begat Enos eight hundred and seven years, and begat sons and daughters:

igala: Oñ i fʼe̩wñ du ki deju ane̩ kpalu, tʼone̩, tʼame̩la abe̩re̩me̩le̩, tʼame̩wñ ki afa, tʼame̩we̩ ojale; ma la fʼu kpalu bʼane̩-ile̩ te̩. Oñ i bo̩ Noa kate kpai abo ku ma jʼugbo-wñ ef o̩ko̩ le̩.
english: And all the days of Seth were nine hundred and twelve years: and he died.

igala:
Oñ omi le̩ fʼukpahiu che bʼane̩-ile̩-i ma o̩jo̩ oli me̩ta.
Omi wobi te̩
english: And Enos lived ninety years, and begat Cainan:

igala: Oñ omi le̩ dabu alo waa gbogbo wʼochu e̩ke̩gwa; ochu e̩ke̩gwa, o̩jo̩ ejodudu ochu le̩, ma li oj uwo oj uwo.
english: And Enos lived after he begat Cainan eight hundred and fifteen years, and begat sons and daughters:

igala: Oñ i ño̩ je̩ o̩jo̩ mebie omune̩ ge̩, tak i je̩ ñw ikede le̩ le dufu; i laño̩ dabi wʼugbo-wñ ge̩ n.
english: And all the days of Enos were nine hundred and five years: and he died.

igala: Oñ i lewatu o̩do̩ ulo̩gwa nyokeʼka, ochu ejodudu, o̩jo̩ ejodudu ochu le̩, omi le̩ gbe̩ bʼane̩-ile̩ te̩; taki Noa mʼoji o̩ko̩ chi, oñ i go, me̩ la go, eju ane̩-ile̩ gbe̩ te̩.
english: And Cainan lived seventy years, and begat Mahalaleel:

igala: Oñ ef ochu ekeji, o̩jo̩ ogu nyoke mebie ochu le̩, ane̩-ile̩ che̩ gbe̩ te̩.
english: And Cainan lived after he begat Mahalaleel eight hundred and forty years, and begat sons and daughters:

igala: Tak O̩jo̩ ka ñwu Noa kakini,
english: And all the days of Cainan were nine hundred and ten years: and he died.

igala: Kwef o̩ko̩ dufu, uwe̩ kpai o̩ya-we̩, kpai amo̩ma-we̩ e̩ne̩ke̩le̩ kpai amo̩ya amo̩ma-we̩ manyʼuwe̩.
english: And Mahalaleel lived sixty and five years, and begat Jared:

igala: Ame̩wñ iñmi du kʼi chʼo̩re̩la ki dʼugbo-we̩ tʼame̩we̩, tʼame̩la abe̩re̩me̩le̩, tʼame̩wñ ki afa e-ki afa ane̩-ile̩-i e̩ nako dufu kpai uwe̩, ku ma ki rabi ane̩-ile̩, ku ma la bi o̩ma, ku ma ño̩ wewe nyo̩gba ane̩-ile̩.
english: And Mahalaleel lived after he begat Jared eight hundred and thirty years, and begat sons and daughters:

igala: Taki Noa ledufu, kpai amo̩ma-wñ kpai o̩ya-wñ kpai amo̩ya amo̩ma-wñ manyʼowñ.
english: And all the days of Mahalaleel were eight hundred ninety and five years: and he died.

igala: Ame̩wñ iñmi okoke du, e̩wñ ki afa okoke du, kpai e̩we̩ okoke du, e̩wñ du ki achiche̩ ane̩-ile̩, kwʼef o̩ko̩ dufu uche̩uche̩.
english: And Jared lived an hundred sixty and two years, and he begat Enoch:

igala: Taki Noa fʼubo̩ iche̩bo̩ ne ñwu Jihofa, oñ i chi kwef ame̩la abe̩re̩me̩le̩ ki de̩hiolo okoke du kpai kwef ame̩we̩ hiolo okoke du, tak i mʼu ko wa chʼiche̩bo̩ e̩gujo oj ubo̩ le̩.
english: And Jared lived after he begat Enoch eight hundred years, and begat sons and daughters:

igala: Jihofa la gbo̩ ekpo kʼi akpo, taki Jihofa ka ef e̩do̩-wñ kakini, U ñʼanama ñw ane̩ todu one̩ ge̩ n, todabu kʼaye e̩do̩ one̩ chʼe̩bie̩ne̩ kwo o̩jo̩ imo̩to̩-wñ; u ñʼadabi kpa ame̩wñ iñmi du alu kʼu che-i ge̩ n.
english: And all the days of Jared were nine hundred sixty and two years: and he died.

igala:
Gbogbo wʼiko kʼane̩-ile̩ kade, adiko e̩yo̩ e̩wñ egbe̩ kpai adiko e̩wñ eja wʼunyi, kpai afu kpai olu, kpai o̩lo̩ji kpai uwo, kpai o̩ro̩ka kpai odu, ñʼada ge̩ n.
O̩jo̩ kpʼalo kpai Noa
english: And Enoch lived sixty and five years, and begat Methuselah:

igala: Tak O̩jo̩ de̩nyo̩ ñwu Noa kpai amo̩ma-wñ e̩ne̩ke̩le̩, oñ i ka ñwu ma kakini, Me̩ ki bi o̩ma ku me̩ wewe nyo̩gba, ku me̩ ko̩ ile̩-i.
english: And Enoch walked with God after he begat Methuselah three hundred years, and begat sons and daughters:

igala: E̩gahi-me̩ kpai ailo-me̩ amʼame̩wñ iñmi okoke du ile̩-i, kpai e̩we̩ ojale okoke, ama kpai e̩wñ du ki afa ane̩ kpai ame̩ja ef ohimini abadi du; ma mʼuma ko jʼef o̩wo̩-me̩.
english: And all the days of Enoch were three hundred sixty and five years:

igala: E̩wñ du ki achiche̩ ki añmiñmi achʼuje̩wñ todu me̩; dabalu kʼe̩wñ oko emimi de̩, abe̩le̩ omi mʼo̩chaka e̩wñ du ko ñwu me̩ me̩.
english:
And Enoch walked with God: and he
was not; for God took him.

igala: Me̩ ki muda je̩ o̩re̩la manyu onugo iñmi-wñ n, owñ chʼe̩bie̩-wñ.
english: And Methuselah lived an hundred eighty and seven years, and begat Lamech:

igala: E̩bie̩-me̩ e-onugo iñmi-me̩ omi atene chuu; o̩wo̩ e̩la du natene owñ kpai o̩wo̩ one̩; ugbo o̩wo̩ o̩maye one̩ pitii natene onugo iñmi one̩.
english: And Methuselah lived after he begat Lamech seven hundred eighty and two years, and begat sons and daughters:

igala: E̩ne̩ du kʼi adʼe̩bie̩ one̩ dafo, lugbo one̩ ma adʼe̩bie̩ e̩ne̩ le̩ dafo; todu O̩jo̩ che one̩ ojibo owñ.
english: And all the days of Methuselah were nine hundred sixty and nine years: and he died.

igala: Ame̩, me̩ nabi o̩ma ku me̩ wewe nyo̩gba, me̩ ki fo̩ji ile̩-i ku me̩ wewe nyo̩gba efu-wñ.
english: And Lamech lived an hundred eighty and two years, and begat a son:

igala: Tak O̩jo̩ ko̩la ñwu Noa kpai amo̩ma-wñ e̩ne̩ke̩le̩ kpai owñ, i kakini,
english:
And he called his name Noah, saying, This
same shall comfort us concerning our work and toil of our hands, because of the ground which the LORD hath cursed.

igala: Nakpʼalo-mi kpai ame̩, uwobi omi ñʼakpʼo̩re̩la du rinyo̩ ge̩ n, uwobi omi lañʼado̩mo̩ ki akpa ane̩-ile̩ bie̩ ge̩ n.
english: And Lamech lived after he begat Noah five hundred ninety and five years, and begat sons and daughters:

igala: O̩ba le̩ adʼef akpa, tak omi onugo agʼo kʼu nadibekado alo-ekpe̩ e-ogbegbele̩ ki dʼagbagba O̩jo̩ kpai onugo ame̩wñ iñmi du ki chʼo̩re̩la, owñ chʼe-du ki dʼane̩-ile̩.
english: And all the days of Lamech were seven hundred seventy and seven years: and he died.

igala:
Tak O̩jo̩ ka ñwu Noa kakini, E-kide̩ chʼujiwe alo kʼomi kpe̩ agbagba omi kpai o̩re̩la du ki jʼane̩-ile̩.
Noa kpai omi achiwebe̩te̩ma le̩
english: And Noah was five hundred years old: and Noah begat Shem, Ham, and Japheth.

igala: Taku She̩m kpai Jefe̩t mʼukpo ubo̩lama ko, ma la mʼu ko nʼika-ma meji, oñ ma le ubi ubi amʼu ko bʼago ofo ata-ma ma; ma fʼeju kparʼugbo omu-ne̩, ma ño̩ li ago ofo ata-ma n.
english: And it came to pass, when men began to multiply on the face of the earth, and daughters were born unto them,

That the sons of God saw the daughters of men that they
were
 fair; and they took them wives of all which they chose.

And the LORD said, My spirit shall not always strive with man, for that he also
is flesh: yet his days shall be an hundred and twenty years.

igala: Abu kʼuwobi omi le̩ le Noa ño̩ dʼo̩do̩ oli mebie.
english:
There were giants in the earth in those days; and also after that, when the sons of God came in unto the daughters of men, and they bare
children
 to them, the same
became mighty men which
were
 of old, men of renown.

igala:
O̩do̩ Noa du la chʼicham nyʼoli me̩ta; tak i leku.
Amo̩ma Noa
english:
And GOD saw that the wickedness of man
was great in the earth, and
that every imagination of the thoughts of his heart
was
 only evil continually.

igala: O̩lo̩pu amo̩ma Noa e-e̩ne̩ke̩le̩ o̩gba o̩gba de̩, She̩m, kpai Ham, kpai Jefe̩t; ma ño̩ fʼamo̩ma e̩ne̩ke̩le̩ bi ñwu ma abu kʼuwobi omi le̩ lale.
english: And it repented the LORD that he had made man on the earth, and it grieved him at his heart.

igala: Amo̩ma e̩ne̩ke̩le̩ Jefe̩t che: Gome̩r, kpai Mago̩g, kpai Madai, kpai Jafan, kpai Tubal, kpai Me̩she̩k, kpai Tiras.
english: And the LORD said, I will destroy man whom I have created from the face of the earth; both man, and beast, and the creeping thing, and the fowls of the air; for it repenteth me that I have made them.

igala: Oñ amo̩ma e̩ne̩ke̩le̩ Gome̩r che: Ashkenaz, kpai Rifat, kpai Togarma.
english: But Noah found grace in the eyes of the LORD.

igala: Amo̩ma e̩ne̩ke̩le̩ Jafan la che: Elisha, kpai Tarshish, Kitim, kpai Dodanim.
english:
These
are the generations of Noah: Noah was a just man
and perfect in his generations,
and Noah walked with God.

igala: Kwef abo-i abo o̩lomi kpe̩ jo̩ ojane̩ ojane̩-ma, e̩ne̩ne̩ne̩ne̩ ne̩ alu kʼichi-wñ, alu kʼakwo̩ra unyi akwo̩ra unyi-ma de̩ ef abo uche̩ichi uche̩ichi-ma.
english: And Noah begat three sons, Shem, Ham, and Japheth.

igala: Amo̩ma e̩ne̩ke̩le̩ Ham la che: Kush, kpai Mizraim, kpai Put, kpai Kenan.
english: The earth also was corrupt before God, and the earth was filled with violence.

igala: Amo̩ma e̩ne̩ke̩le̩ Kush la che; Seba, kpai Hafila, kpai Sabta, kpai Raama, kpai Sabte̩ka. Amo̩ma Raama la che: Shiba kpai Dedan.
english: And God looked upon the earth, and, behold, it was corrupt; for all flesh had corrupted his way upon the earth.

igala: Kush ño̩ bi Nimro̩d; owñ chʼuchane̩ agbiti ane̩-ile̩.
english: And God said unto Noah, The end of all flesh is come before me; for the earth is filled with violence through them; and, behold, I will destroy them with the earth.

igala: I chʼagbiti o̩de̩ eju Jihofa; todule̩ ma kakini, Dabu Nimro̩d kʼi chʼagbiti o̩de̩ ede̩ eju Jihofa.
english: Make thee an ark of gopher wood; rooms shalt thou make in the ark, and shalt pitch it within and without with pitch.

igala: Uchane̩ ojane̩-wñ la che Bebe̩l, kpai E̩re̩k, kpai Akad, kpai Kalne̩ ojane̩ Shainar.
english:
And this
is the fashion which thou shalt make it
of:
 The length of the ark
shall be three hundred cubits, the breadth of it fifty cubits, and the height of it thirty cubits.

igala: Alo̩me̩ abo Kenan le̩ la kwo Saido̩n, abu kʼe̩ nyʼo̩wo̩ Gerar, gbogbo wa Gaza; abu kʼe̩ nyʼo̩wo̩ So̩do̩m kpai Go̩mo̩ra kpai Adma, kpai Ze̩boim, gbogbo wa Easha.
english:
A window shalt thou make to the ark, and in a cubit shalt thou finish it above; and the door of the ark shalt thou set in the side thereof;
with
 lower, second, and third
stories shalt thou make it.

igala: Abo-i chʼamo̩ma e̩ne̩ke̩le̩ Ham, akwo̩ra unyi, akwo̩ra unyi-ma, ichi ichi-ma, ojane̩ ojane̩-ma, ef abo uche̩ichi uche̩ichi-ma.
english:
And, behold, I, even I, do bring a flood of waters upon the earth, to destroy all flesh, wherein
is the breath of life, from under heaven;
and every thing that
is in the earth shall die.

igala: Taku ma ño̩ bi amo̩ma ñwu She̩m kʼi chʼata amo̩ma E̩be̩r chaka; She̩m le̩ chʼacho̩gba Jefe̩t.
english: But with thee will I establish my covenant; and thou shalt come into the ark, thou, and thy sons, and thy wife, and thy sons’ wives with thee.

igala: Amo̩ma e̩ne̩ke̩le̩ She̩m che: Elam, kpai Ashur, kpai Arpaksad, kpai Lud, kpai Aram.
english:
And of every living thing of all flesh, two of every
sort
 shalt thou bring into the ark, to keep
them alive with thee; they shall be male and female.

igala: Amo̩ma e̩ne̩ke̩le̩ Aram la che: Uz, kpai Hul, kpai Ge̩te̩r, kpai Mash.
english:
Of fowls after their kind, and of cattle after their kind, of every creeping thing of the earth after his kind, two of every
sort shall come unto thee, to keep
them alive.

igala: Oñ Arpaksad bi Shela; Shela la bi E̩be̩r.
english:
And take thou unto thee of all food that is eaten, and thou shalt gather
it to thee; and it shall be for food for thee, and for them.

igala: Oñ ma bi amo̩ma e̩ne̩ke̩le̩ meji ñw E̩be̩r: odu oka ko̩ Pe̩le̩g; todu ef adiko-wñ ma fʼile̩ kpe̩ru; odu o̩maye-wñ la ko̩ Jo̩ktan.
english: Thus did Noah; according to all that God commanded him, so did he.

igala: O̩lo̩pu Te̩ra o̩gba o̩gba la de̩. Te̩ra bi Ebram, kpai Neho̩r, kpai Haran; Haran la bi Lo̩t.
english: And the LORD said unto Noah, Come thou and all thy house into the ark; for thee have I seen righteous before me in this generation.

igala: Oñ Haran leku dʼo̩gba ata-wñ Te̩ra ane̩ ugbo ku ma jʼubi-wñ, ane̩ Ur e-abo Kaldia le̩.
english:
Of every clean beast thou shalt take to thee by sevens, the male and his female: and of beasts that
are not clean by two, the male and his female.

igala: Ebram kpai Neho̩r la nʼo̩ya ñw o̩la-ma; odu o̩ya Ebram ko̩ Se̩rai, odu o̩ya Nehor la ko Milka, o̩ma Haran kʼi chʼata Milka kpai ata Iska.
english: Of fowls also of the air by sevens, the male and the female; to keep seed alive upon the face of all the earth.

igala: Se̩rai la chʼagaji; i nʼo̩ma n.
english: For yet seven days, and I will cause it to rain upon the earth forty days and forty nights; and every living substance that I have made will I destroy from off the face of the earth.

igala: Taku Te̩ra mʼo̩ma-wñ Ebram du kpai Lo̩t o̩ma Haran, aaju-wñ le̩, kpai Se̩rai o̩ya o̩ma-wñ Ebram, oñ ma kpe̩re̩ kwo Ur e-abo Kaldia dufu ku ma nyʼojane̩ Kenan; taku ma lewa Haran, oñ ma kwojo̩ o̩mo̩.
english: And Noah did according unto all that the LORD commanded him.

igala:
Oñ o̩do̩ Te̩ra chʼo̩do̩ o̩gwo̩ko̩ nyoke me̩lu; taku Te̩ra leku Haran o̩mo̩.
Inabali Ebraham; O̩jo̩ fʼu do̩; Ebraham nyi Kenan
english:
And Noah
was six hundred years old when the flood of waters was upon the earth.

igala: Jihofa la ka ñwu Ebram me̩, kakini, Kwʼojane̩-we̩ dufu kpai kwugbo amefu-we̩ kpai kwugbo unyi ata-we̩ kʼe̩ lo tʼane̩ kʼu nadu ñʼuwe̩.
english: And Noah went in, and his sons, and his wife, and his sons’ wives with him, into the ark, because of the waters of the flood.

igala: Tak u nadʼuwe̩ che abo uche̩ichi elile, oñ nade̩nyo̩ ñw e̩, nache odu-we̩ ki nana, uwe̩ ki la mud e̩nyo̩ ñw amone̩.
english:
Of clean beasts, and of beasts that
are not clean, and of fowls, and of every thing that creepeth upon the earth,

igala: U ñʼade̩nyo̩ ñw abo ku ma kadua ñw e̩, oñ e̩ne̩ kʼi anama ñw e̩ na nama ñw u; oñ efu-we̩ ma ade̩nyo̩ ñw akwo̩ra unyi akwo̩ra unyi ane̩-ile̩-i du.
english: There went in two and two unto Noah into the ark, the male and the female, as God had commanded Noah.

igala: Oñ Ebram le, alu ku Jihofa ko̩la ñw u; Lo̩t ño̩ lebʼo̩. O̩do̩ Ebram la chʼo̩gbo̩ me̩ta nyoke me̩gwe̩lu e̩gba kʼi kwo Haran.
english: And it came to pass after seven days, that the waters of the flood were upon the earth.

igala: Taku Jihofa kwotejugede ñw Ebram, oñ i kakini, Ugbe̩-we̩ oñ omi adʼane̩ kide̩ ñw u. Tak o̩mo̩ i fʼubo̩ iche̩bo̩ ne ñwu Jihofa, kʼi kwotejugede ñw u le̩.
english: In the six hundredth year of Noah’s life, in the second month, the seventeenth day of the month, the same day were all the fountains of the great deep broken up, and the windows of heaven were opened.

igala: I ño̩ kwʼo̩mo̩ nyʼugbo uwo ki dʼo̩wo̩ olodudu Be̩te̩l, oñ i fʼunyabo-wñ fa, Be̩te̩l de̩ olane̩-wñ, Ai la de̩ olodudu; o̩mo̩ i ño̩ fʼubo̩ iche̩bo̩ ne ñwu Jihofa ge̩ tak i do̩ odu Jihofa.
english: And the rain was upon the earth forty days and forty nights.

igala:
Tak Ebram ño̩ kʼe̩re̩ nyʼule̩, tʼo̩wo̩ o̩pata o̩gane̩ alo waa.
Ebraham dʼIjipti
english: In the selfsame day entered Noah, and Shem, and Ham, and Japheth, the sons of Noah, and Noah’s wife, and the three wives of his sons with them, into the ark;

igala: Ukpo̩ta la dʼojane̩ le̩ akpa. Oñ Ebram gwo̩ru nyʼIjipti kʼi ge̩ne̩ o̩mo̩, todu ukpo̩ta akpa tabale ojane̩ le̩.
english: They, and every beast after his kind, and all the cattle after their kind, and every creeping thing that creepeth upon the earth after his kind, and every fowl after his kind, every bird of every sort.

igala: Narodubʼe̩ kʼuwe̩ ki ka kʼe̩ chʼo̩maye-mi, todu ki nyo̩ ñw omi lʼo̩la-we̩, todu kʼonugo-mi ki deju lʼugbo we̩.
english:
And they went in unto Noah into the ark, two and two of all flesh, wherein
is the breath of life.

igala: Oñ i lewatu e̩gba kʼEbram lewa Ijipti abo Ijipti go onobule̩ le̩ kʼi chefe̩rʼeju nana.
english: And they that went in, went in male and female of all flesh, as God had commanded him: and the LORD shut him in.

igala: Tak amagboji Fero fʼowñ li, oñ ma ñwulo̩-wñ ñwu Fero. Taku ma mʼonobule̩ le̩ du le tef unyi Fero.
english: And the flood was forty days upon the earth; and the waters increased, and bare up the ark, and it was lift up above the earth.

igala: Tak i che e̩nyo̩ ñw Ebram todu owñ; oñ Ebram ne̩ ame̩wño̩re̩ egini kpai amokuno̩ kpai amo̩ke̩ke̩te̩ o̩ko̩ kpai amadu e̩ne̩ke̩le̩ kpai amadu onobule̩ kpai amo̩ke̩ke̩te̩ ole kpai aminyakulumi.
english: And the waters prevailed, and were increased greatly upon the earth; and the ark went upon the face of the waters.

igala: Taku Jihofa je̩ ñw atulubo̩ elile ki lewa bu Fero kpai abunyi-wñ ma todu Se̩rai, o̩ya Ebram.
english:
And the waters prevailed exceedingly upon the earth; and all the high hills, that
were under the whole heaven, were covered.

igala: Taku Fero fʼEbram do̩, oñ i kakini, E̩wñ chʼe-kʼuwe̩ che mi-i? E̩wñ chi kʼe̩ ma ka ñwu mi kʼowñ chʼo̩ya-we̩ n?
english: Fifteen cubits upward did the waters prevail; and the mountains were covered.

igala: E̩wñ chi kʼuwe̩ kakini, Owñ chʼo̩maye-mi, kʼomi la mʼu du chʼo̩ya-mi? Todule̩ e̩ la go, o̩ya-we̩ de̩, mʼowñ du, kʼe̩ lo we̩.
english: And all flesh died that moved upon the earth, both of fowl, and of cattle, and of beast, and of every creeping thing that creepeth upon the earth, and every man:

igala:
Taku Fero ñwa ñw abo-wñ ugbo o̩la-wñ; taku ma fʼahite̩-wñ che, kpai o̩ya-wñ kpai e̩wñ du kʼi ne̩.
Ebraham kpai Lo̩t mudaru
english:
All in whose nostrils
was the breath of life, of all that
was in the dry
land, died.

igala: Abe̩le̩ Ebram mute̩gu kwʼIjipti alo, owñ kpai o̩ya-wñ, kpai e̩wñ du kʼi ne̩, Lo̩t la dʼugbo-wñ, ma le tʼo̩wo̩ o̩pata o̩gane̩.
english:
And every living substance was destroyed which was upon the face of the ground, both man, and cattle, and the creeping things, and the fowl of the heaven; and they were destroyed from the earth: and Noah only remained
alive, and they that
were with him in the ark.

igala: Ame̩wñ ukpa kpai ajifa kpai o̩jamalia Ebram la gbe̩gbe̩.
english: And the waters prevailed upon the earth an hundred and fifty days.

igala: O̩go̩ sidim le̩ la che̩ko̩ ñw o̩fe̩ o̩bia bitume̩n; tak amonu So̩do̩m kpai Go̩mo̩ra ra, oñ ma leane̩ o̩mo̩, tak abo ki bo̩ ra tʼoj uwo le̩.
english:
And God remembered Noah, and every living thing, and all the cattle that
was with him in the ark: and God made a wind to pass over the earth, and the waters asswaged;

igala: Tak e̩ne̩ʼka kʼi fʼuma o̩wo̩ lewa ka ñw Ebram, e̩ne̩ Hibru, kʼi la gugu ugbo te̩re̩bint e-Mamre e̩ne̩ Amo̩r, kʼi chʼo̩maye E̩shko̩l le̩, kpai o̩maye Ane̩r; abo le̩ chʼame̩ne̩-uma Ebram.
english: The fountains also of the deep and the windows of heaven were stopped, and the rain from heaven was restrained;

igala: Tak e̩gba kʼEbram gbo̩ kʼogu fʼo̩maye-wñ je̩, i mʼabo-wñ ku ma ko̩che̩ ogu kodufu, owñ chʼabo ku ma bi ma ef unyi-wñ, one̩ oli me̩fa nyoke me̩gwe̩jo̩ ma che, oñ i ra no ma gbogbo wa Dan.
english: And the waters returned from off the earth continually: and after the end of the hundred and fifty days the waters were abated.

igala: Tak i fʼabo-wñ kpe̩ru wa bʼuma ma odu, owñ kpai amadu-wñ, oñ i gwo ma i ño̩ ra no ma gbogbo wa Hoba, kʼi dʼo̩wo̩ awohi Damaskus.
english: And the ark rested in the seventh month, on the seventeenth day of the month, upon the mountains of Ararat.

igala: Oñ i mʼane̩ chaka gba dabi wa i laño̩ mʼo̩maye-wñ Lo̩t du dabi wa kpai ane̩-wñ ge̩, kpai abobule̩ kpai amone̩ le̩ du.
english:
And the waters decreased continually until the tenth month: in the tenth
month, on the first
day of the month, were the tops of the mountains seen.

igala:
Abu kʼi doji awa kwugbo ku ma kpa Chedo̩rlaome̩r kpai amonu ku ma jʼugbo-wñ, onu So̩do̩m ledufu kʼi ledʼowñ ugbo O̩go̩ Shafe̩ (owñ chʼO̩go̩ Onu).
Me̩lke̩side̩k kadua ñw Ebraham
english: And it came to pass at the end of forty days, that Noah opened the window of the ark which he had made:

igala: Taku Me̩lke̩side̩k onu Se̩le̩m kʼakala kpai omi achiwebe̩te̩ma dufu wa; owñ la chʼatama O̩jo̩ Chamachala.
english: And he sent forth a raven, which went forth to and fro, until the waters were dried up from off the earth.
Also he sent forth a dove from him, to see if the waters were abated from off the face of the ground;

igala:
O̩jo̩ Chamachala kʼi nʼele,
Owñ ki mʼame̩nebi-we̩ ko jʼef o̩wo̩-we̩ le̩!
Tak i fʼe̩wñ le̩ du kpe̩ e̩gwa e̩gwa, oñ i mʼojiʼka ko ñw u.
english:
But the dove found no rest for the sole of her foot, and she returned unto him into the ark, for the waters
were on the face of the whole earth: then he put forth his hand, and took her, and pulled her in unto him into the ark.

igala: Tak onu So̩do̩m ka ñw Ebram kakini, Mʼamonugo amone̩ le̩ ko ñwu mi kʼuwe̩ ki gwo̩nyu ane̩ le̩.
english: And he stayed yet other seven days; and again he sent forth the dove out of the ark;

igala:
Chai e-kʼabo okolobia je̩ kate, kpai ukpe̩ aboke̩le̩ ku ma lebʼumi; Ane̩r kpai E̩shko̩l, kpai Mamre le̩ ki gba ukpe̩ e-ma.
O̩jo̩ ka kʼi adʼo̩ma ñw Ebraham, kpai ane̩ Kenan ge̩
english:
And the dove came in to him in the evening; and, lo, in her mouth
was an olive leaf pluckt off: so Noah knew that the waters were abated from off the earth.

igala: Ubi e̩wñ-i ge̩ o̩la Jihofa wʼugbo Ebram ef ane̩ ego, kakini, E̩ ki railo n, Ebram, omi chʼugbe̩yo̩-we̩; kpai uro̩me̩-we̩ ki nana ololo.
english: And he stayed yet other seven days; and sent forth the dove; which returned not again unto him any more.

igala: Tak Ebram kakini, Ondu Jihofa, e̩wñ e̩ du ñwu mi, abu kʼu nache kʼu tʼile̩ no̩ kʼu ma nʼo̩ma n, e̩ne̩ ki ane̩ unyi-mi la che E̩lieza e-Damaskus le̩?
english:
And it came to pass in the six hundredth and first year, in the first
month, the first
day of the month, the waters were dried up from off the earth: and Noah removed the covering of the ark, and looked, and, behold, the face of the ground was dry.

igala: Oñ Ebram kakini, Go, uwe̩ du ugbe̩ do̩ ñwu mi n; e̩ go, e̩ne̩ ku ma bi ef unyi-mi ofofo mud e̩ne̩ kʼi aje̩ e̩wñ ogu-mi.
english: And in the second month, on the seven and twentieth day of the month, was the earth dried.

igala: Tak o̩la Jihofa wʼugbo owñ kakini, E̩ne̩ kʼe̩ ka-i chʼe̩ne̩ kʼi aje̩ e̩wñ ogu-we̩ n; chai e̩ne̩ kʼi akwef ifi-we̩ onugo aje̩ e̩wñ ogu-we̩.
english: And God spake unto Noah, saying,

igala: Tak i mʼowñ du dufu wʼo̩do̩da oñ i kakini, Chi eju-we̩ nyʼojale kʼe̩ go, kʼe̩ kaluka awo ki jo̩ le̩, iche̩wñ kʼuwe̩ aneke kaluka-wñ. Tak i ka ñw u kakini, Abe̩le̩ ugbe̩-we̩ ade̩.
english: Go forth of the ark, thou, and thy wife, and thy sons, and thy sons’ wives with thee.

igala:
Tak i dʼo̩la Jihofa rʼochochi; oñ i fʼe-le̩ lorʼo̩kpakpa ñw u.
Alo ekpe̩ manyʼe̩wñ kʼi ka tane̩ le̩
english:
Bring forth with thee every living thing that
is with thee, of all flesh,
both of fowl, and of cattle, and of every creeping thing that creepeth upon the earth; that they may breed abundantly in the earth, and be fruitful, and multiply upon the earth.

igala: Tak i ka ñw u kakini, Omi che Jihofa kʼi dʼuwe̩ kwo Ur e-abo Kaldia wa, kʼu dʼane̩ kide̩ ñw e̩ kʼe̩ ne̩.
english: And Noah went forth, and his sons, and his wife, and his sons’ wives with him:

igala: Tak i kakini, Ondu Jihofa, lugbo e̩wñ oñ nama ka kʼu nane̩-i?
english:
Every beast, every creeping thing, and every fowl,
and whatsoever creepeth upon the earth, after their kinds, went forth out of the ark.

igala: Tak i ka ñw u kakini, Mʼagbadufu ole okuno̩, kpai ole ewo, kpai okolo kʼo̩do̩-ma chʼe̩ta e̩ta, kpai ikede, kpai o̩ma o̩ke̩te̩be̩ kowa ñwu mi.
english: And Noah builded an altar unto the LORD; and took of every clean beast, and of every clean fowl, and offered burnt offerings on the altar.

igala: Tak i mʼe̩wñ-i kowa ñw u chaka, oñ i fʼuma kpana nyigba, tak i mʼe̩kpana ojiʼka du tʼo̩wo̩ʼka oñ i mʼe̩kpana ekeji du tʼo̩wo̩ ekeji, chai ame̩we̩ kate oñ i ma kpana n.
english:
And the LORD smelled a sweet savour; and the LORD said in his heart, I will not again curse the ground any more for man’s sake; for the imagination of man’s heart
is evil from his youth; neither will I again smite any more every thing living, as I have done.

igala: Tak ame̩we̩ ku ma kpʼe̩la je̩ gwo̩ru bʼoku le̩ ma, oñ Ebram fʼuma ne.
english: While the earth remaineth, seedtime and harvest, and cold and heat, and summer and winter, and day and night shall not cease.

igala: Owñ la adʼef amone̩ dab o̩ke̩ke̩te̩ efoko; o̩wo̩-wñ achʼagwunyu e̩ne̩ du, o̩wo̩ e̩ne̩ du achʼagwunyu owñ; owñ la agugu akpejuru amo̩maye-wñ chaka.
english: And God blessed Noah and his sons, and said unto them, Be fruitful, and multiply, and replenish the earth.

igala: Tak i dʼodu Jihofa e-kʼi ko̩la ñw u ko̩, Uwe̩ chʼO̩jo̩ kʼi agane̩, todu i kakini, U ño̩ dʼemi agʼo abu kʼi fʼumi go?
english:
And the fear of you and the dread of you shall be upon every beast of the earth, and upon every fowl of the air, upon all that moveth
upon
 the earth, and upon all the fishes of the sea; into your hand are they delivered.

igala: Todule̩ ma do̩ obuga le̩ ko Bir-lehairo̩i; go, i dʼagbagba Kede̩sh kpai Be̩re̩d.
english: Every moving thing that liveth shall be meat for you; even as the green herb have I given you all things.

igala: Oñ Hega fʼo̩ma e̩ne̩ke̩le̩ bi ñw Ebram; Ebram la dʼodu o̩ma e̩ne̩ke̩le̩ ku Hega bi ñw u le̩ ko̩ Ishmae̩l.
english:
But flesh with the life thereof,
which is the blood thereof, shall ye not eat.

igala:
O̩do̩ Ebram la chʼo̩gbo̩ me̩le̩ nyoke me̩fa e̩gba ku Hega bi Ishmae̩l ñw Ebram.
Alo ekpe̩ e-e̩pi eda le̩
english: And surely your blood of your lives will I require; at the hand of every beast will I require it, and at the hand of man; at the hand of every man’s brother will I require the life of man.

igala: E̩gba kʼo̩do̩ Ebram jo̩ o̩gbo me̩le̩ nyoke me̩gwe̩la Jihofa kwotejugede ñw Ebram, i la ka ñw u kakini, Omi chʼO̩jo̩ Odobogagu; e̩ ki lule̩ eju-mi, o̩la-we̩ ki mufu.
english: Whoso sheddeth man’s blood, by man shall his blood be shed: for in the image of God made he man.

igala: Tak omi akpʼalo-mi agbagba omi kpai uwe̩, naño̩ che kʼuwe̩ ki wewe nyo̩gba ololo.
english: And you, be ye fruitful, and multiply; bring forth abundantly in the earth, and multiply therein.

igala: Ebram la fʼeju bʼane̩ ma; oñ O̩jo̩ ko̩la ñw u kakini,
english: And God spake unto Noah, and to his sons with him, saying,

igala: I chʼomi, go, alo-mi kʼu kpe̩ i chʼomi kpai uwe̩, uwe̩ la achʼata abo uche̩ichi ojoji ojoji wewe.
english: And I, behold, I establish my covenant with you, and with your seed after you;

igala: Ma ñʼadʼodu-we̩ ko̩ Ebram ge̩ n, ama odu-we̩ ako̩ Ebraham; todu ata amone̩ uche̩ichi ojoji wewe omi dʼuwe̩ che.
english:
And with every living creature that
is with you, of the fowl, of the cattle, and of every beast of the earth with you; from all that go out of the ark, to every beast of the earth.

igala: U ñʼaje̩ ñw e̩ nʼugbe̩ ololo, nache kʼuwe̩ mud uche̩ichi amone̩ ojoji ojoji, amonu la akwʼef uwe̩ dufu ge̩.
english: And I will establish my covenant with you; neither shall all flesh be cut off any more by the waters of a flood; neither shall there any more be a flood to destroy the earth.

igala: Nadu alo-mi dago agbagba omi kpai uwe̩ kpai ugbe̩-we̩ ubi-we̩ ge̩ gbogbo tʼo̩gba o̩gba-ma du kʼi chʼalo e-ogbegbele̩, kʼu nachʼO̩jo̩ ñw e̩ kpai ugbe̩-we̩ ubi-we̩ ge̩.
english:
And God said, This
is the token of the covenant which I make between me and you and every living creature that
is with you, for perpetual generations:

igala: Nadʼane̩ ugbo kʼe̩ ge̩ne̩ le̩, owñ chʼane̩ Kenan du, ñw e̩, kpai ugbe̩-we̩ ubi-we̩ kʼi mud e̩wñ-me̩ ogbegbele̩; u ñʼachʼO̩jo̩-ma.
english: I do set my bow in the cloud, and it shall be for a token of a covenant between me and the earth.

igala: Tak O̩jo̩ ka ñw Ebraham kakini, I la chʼuwe̩, uwe̩ ade alo-mi, uwe̩ kpai ugbe̩-we̩ ubi-we̩ tʼo̩gba o̩gba-ma.
english: And it shall come to pass, when I bring a cloud over the earth, that the bow shall be seen in the cloud:

igala: Alo-mi ku me̩ la ade la de̩, i tʼagbagba mi kpai uwe̩ kpai ugbe̩-we̩ ubi-we̩ ge̩: kakini, E̩ne̩ke̩le̩ du efu-me̩ adʼe̩pi.
english:
And I will remember my covenant, which
is between me and you and every living creature of all flesh; and the waters shall no more become a flood to destroy all flesh.

igala: Me̩ la ada o̩re̩la e-año̩ ki bʼo̩gba-me̩ ma le̩, oñ e-le̩ achʼujiwe alo ki tʼagbagba omi kpai ame̩.
english:
And the bow shall be in the cloud; and I will look upon it, that I may remember the everlasting covenant between God and every living creature of all flesh that
is upon the earth.

igala: Me̩ la adʼe̩pi o̩ma e̩ne̩ke̩le̩ du o̩gba o̩gba me̩ o̩jo̩ e̩ke̩jo̩ ku ma bi, tʼe̩ne̩ ku me̩ bi unyi, tʼe̩ne̩ ku me̩ dʼo̩ko̩ la ugbo ononojo du ki ma chʼugbe̩ e-we̩ n.
english:
And God said unto Noah, This
is the token of the covenant, which I have established between me and all flesh that
is upon the earth.

igala: E̩ne̩ ku ma bi ef unyi-we̩ kpai e̩ne̩ kʼuwe̩ nʼo̩ko̩-we̩ la, ma adʼe̩pi-ma chuu. Abe̩le̩ alo-mi adʼef o̩re̩la-me̩ ki chʼalo ogbegbele̩.
english: And the sons of Noah, that went forth of the ark, were Shem, and Ham, and Japheth: and Ham is the father of Canaan.

igala: Oñ e̩ne̩ke̩le̩ du ki ma dʼe̩pi n kʼi ma la da o̩re̩la e-año̩ ki bʼo̩gba-wñ ma le̩ n, ma amʼonugo e̩ne̩ le̩ daru bʼabo-wñ te̩; i fʼalo-mi bie̩ me̩.
english:
These
are the three sons of Noah: and of them was the whole earth overspread.

igala: Tak O̩jo̩ ka ñw Ebraham kakini, I chʼe-Se̩rai, o̩ya-we̩, uwe̩ ki dʼodu-wñ ko̩ Se̩rai ge̩ n, chai Sara chʼodu-wñ.
english:
And Noah began
to be an husbandman, and he planted a vineyard:
